00001 package com.placesandplaces;
00002 
00003 import java.io.IOException;
00004 
00005 import com.rabbitmq.client.Channel;
00006 import com.rabbitmq.client.Connection;
00007 import com.rabbitmq.client.ConnectionFactory;
00008 
00009 //code inspired and built upon: http://simonwdixon.wordpress.com/2011/06/03/getting-started-with-rabbitmq-on-android-part-1/
00010 public abstract class RabbitMQConn {
00011         // declare rabbitmq variables
00012         public String mServer;
00013         public String mExchange;
00014 
00015         protected Channel mModel = null;
00016         protected Connection mConnection;
00017 
00018         protected boolean Running;
00019 
00020         protected String ExchangeType;
00021 
00022         public RabbitMQConn(String server, String exchange,
00023                         String exchangeType) {
00024                 mServer = server;
00025                 mExchange = exchange;
00026                 ExchangeType = exchangeType;
00027         }
00028 
00029         public void Dispose() {
00030                 Running = false;
00031                 try {
00032 
00033                         if (mConnection != null) {
00034                                 mConnection.close();
00035                         }// end if
00036 
00037                         if (mModel != null) {
00038                                 mModel.abort();
00039                         }// end if
00040                 }// end try
00041                 catch (IOException e) {
00042                         e.printStackTrace();
00043                 }
00044         }
00045 
00046         public boolean connectToRabbitMQ() {
00047                 if (mModel != null && mModel.isOpen())// already declared
00048                         return true;
00049                 try {
00050                         ConnectionFactory connectionFactory = new ConnectionFactory();
00051                         connectionFactory.setHost(mServer);
00052                         mConnection = connectionFactory.newConnection();
00053                         mModel = mConnection.createChannel();
00054                         mModel.exchangeDeclare(mExchange, ExchangeType, true);
00055                         return true;
00056                 } catch (Exception e) {
00057                         e.printStackTrace();
00058                         return false;
00059                 }
00060         }
00061 }
